document-title: Request a review of a decision
page-title: Request a review of a decision
recon: Step 1: Ask Service Canada to reconsider
recon.1: If you disagree with a decision about your pension application, you can ask Service Canada to reconsider.
recon.2: You have 90 days to ask for a reconsideration after you get your decision letter from Service Canada.
recon.3: A Service Canada employee who didnâ€™t make the original decision will review your application.
sst: Step 2: Appeal to the Social Security Tribunal
sst.1: If Service Canada reconsiders and you disagree with the new decision, you can appeal to the Social Security Tribunal (SST).
sst.2: You have 90 days to appeal after you get your reconsideration decision (new decision) from Service Canada.
sst.3: Appealing to the SST is separate from the process you followed at Service Canada.
